name: Rep. Lloyd Smucker
tweet_text: 10/10 – This editorial is disgraceful.

name: Rep. Lloyd Smucker
tweet_text: 9/10-I would have hoped for better. The sad reality, is that in this instance you are failing our community. Dividing instead of uniting. Attempting to stir controversy amongst elected officials when the only controversy is that we are not doing more to support nursing homes.

name: Rep. Lloyd Smucker
tweet_text: 8/10-You are continuing to demoralize those heroic employees working everyday at these facilities. They need support now more than ever. Not a suggestion that they are in the middle of a political fight or that they are holding our reopening hostage. This is dangerous.

name: Rep. Lloyd Smucker
tweet_text: 7/10-I have never called on Gov. Wolf to preclude COVID-19 deaths in nursing homes from our county’s consideration of reopening. Not once. I’ve questioned his metrics (50/100k) and I’ve asked him to be transparent and collaborative. But, the facts don’t matter to #FakeNews

name: Rep. Lloyd Smucker
tweet_text: 6/10- I have called for a robust response to our nursing home facilities because they are the places with the greatest needs and populations at greatest risk of significant harm from COVID-19.

name: Rep. Lloyd Smucker
tweet_text: 5/10-The narrative that there is some growing “blame game” or “political clash” is absurd and misses the point that elected officials in Lancaster agree on almost all aspects of responding to this crisis.

name: Rep. Lloyd Smucker
tweet_text: 4/10-What you, @SuzCassidyLNP or other staff members at LNP, are doing to make tragic deaths at nursing homes a “political flashpoint” as Thursday’s article stated, is outrageous. It’s despicable.

name: Rep. Lloyd Smucker
tweet_text: 3/10- No. You do not seem to understand what I’m saying @SuzCassidyLNP . This level of attempted character assassination is shameful.

name: Rep. Lloyd Smucker

We saw it in Parkland. We saw it again in Aurora, Illinois. 

I'm sponsoring a bill to help fix these problems and address them head on. Look for info later today.

name: Rep. Lloyd Smucker
tweet_text:
#HR8 is not gun control. 

It's an attempt to criminalize law-abiding citizens.

name: Rep. Lloyd Smucker
tweet_text:
Let’s say you plan a hunting trip with your friend but at the last minute your friend gets sick and can’t go. 

You ask to borrow your friend’s rifle. They lend it to you for the weekend. 

Under #HR8, doing something like that could lead to a year in prison and a $100,000 fine.

name: Rep. Lloyd Smucker
tweet_text: It will be important that Congress continues to monitor and review the president’s role in this process to ensure the actions taken are within constitutional and statutory authority.

name: Rep. Lloyd Smucker
tweet_text: Emergency declarations do not allow the President to circumvent the Constitution. President Trump’s exercise of national emergency powers is limited. He is not creating a new law or allocating additional funding. He is re-appropriating money already set aside for other projects.

name: Rep. Lloyd Smucker
tweet_text: It’s Congress’ duty to ensure the President is acting within his constitutional authority to address that crisis. After research and consideration, I believe Trump is acting within his authority to take this action.

name: Rep. Lloyd Smucker
tweet_text: Emergency declarations should not be taken lightly. President Trump has made a strong case that there’s a humanitarian crisis at our southern border – and I agree.

name: Rep. Lloyd Smucker
tweet_text: Simply put, the House has now missed two opportunities to fix our broken immigration system and make our country more safe, secure, and prosperous. The American people deserve better than the failed status quo. https://t.co/ucw05tgN6Y

name: Rep. Lloyd Smucker
tweet_text: The legislation offered by Chairman Bob Goodlatte that failed in the House last week – Securing America’s Future Act – was a great opportunity reform our immigration system. That’s why I voted for it. https://t.co/ucw05tgN6Y

name: Rep. Lloyd Smucker
tweet_text: This legislation also missed an opportunity to make needed reforms to our agricultural immigrant labor programs, make E-Verify law of the land, and address the vast worker shortage found in Pennsylvania and across the country. https://t.co/ucw05tgN6Y

name: Rep. Lloyd Smucker
tweet_text: The bill does not hold sanctuary cities accountable for protecting dangerous criminals, nor does it crack down on individuals overstaying their visa. These are two critical priorities that must be addressed. https://t.co/ucw05tgN6Y

name: Rep. Lloyd Smucker
tweet_text: Our badly-broken immigration system must be fixed, but the legislation before the House today was not the solution. https://t.co/XAqIIBDjlW

RT @LancasterOnline: .@RepSmucker: 'Broken' immigration system allows children to be separated from parents 
https://t.co/090LeucMjA https:…

name: Rep. Lloyd Smucker
tweet_text: 3/3: That’s why I’m contacting @DHSgov Secretary Kirstjen Nielsen to get more information from her about how Congress can prevent separating families while ensuring a strong and secure border.

name: Rep. Lloyd Smucker
tweet_text: 2/3: But our immigration system is broken, and currently allows for families to be separated. Congress should address this issue, and the first step is having all the facts.

name: Rep. Lloyd Smucker
tweet_text: 1/3: Reading reports of what’s happening at our border and evaluating current policy, you can’t help but have an emotional response. Like all of us, and as a father, I believe families should remain together whenever possible.
